medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant abdominal pain radiating to the epigastrium.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with twelve hours of right upper quadrant abdominal pain that radiated to the epigastrium. Symptoms began with nausea but no vomiting or fevers; the patient reported this type of pain was new as it had never occurred before. After being discharged on pain medication, the pain temporarily improved but returned after dinner with increased intensity, prompting the hospital visit.
